location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 213: Lieutenant-Colonel Samuel Hennell, Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushire, to Arthur Malet, Chief Secretary to the Government, Bombay

mods.abstract: Samuel Hennell forwards a copy of a letter, dated 15 March 1850, from Lieutenant-Colonel Justin Sheil, Her Majesty's Minister at the Court of Persia, on the subject of certain complaints made against the Government Agent at Shiraz, Mirza Mahmood, together with transcripts of Hennell's replies, dated 16 and 17 May 1850, exonerating Mirza Mahmood from the charges brought against him. The letters are not included here but do appear earlier in the volume (see ff.52-53, ff.68-72 and f.73 respectively).
